description: This course will look at the proposition that one practical way to improve the life prospects of low-income citizens is to increase the supply of well-designed, well-managed, high-performance community-service programs that meet thsese citizens' most pressing needs. The course will examine leadership in the context of developing and implementing effective community-service programs. The primary course objectives include 1) acquiring knowledge about current models and approaches to community-service programs including an understanding of effective practices and 2) developing a basic understanding of how program evaluation can strengthen program implementation. The seminar will include case studies, field work, an occasional lecture and several outside speakers. The case studies will focus on after-school, youth violence reduction, faith-based, health-related and mentoring programs. This is an IDEAS IN ACTION course.
name: LEADERSHIP IN COMM SERVI: Leadership in Community Service
